<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Harrow Spellcards](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2178)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Grimoire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=387" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 112 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 425 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Crafted of sturdy paper, each card of this [harrow deck](/Equipment.aspx?ID=824) showcases a beautiful watercolor illustration with space to inscribe a spell below. When shuffled, its cards seem to fly between one another of their own accord.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=612)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** Your last action was to cast a spell prepared from this grimoire that has the [detection](/Traits.aspx?ID=574), [prediction](/Traits.aspx?ID=674), [revelation](/Traits.aspx?ID=686), or [scrying](/Traits.aspx?ID=689) trait;  **Effect** You draw forth a card to gain insight into future challenges you’ll face. Draw a card from a harrow deck or roll 1d6: 1 = hammers ([Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36)), 2 = keys ([Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34)), 3 = shields ([Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49)), 4 = books (any [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=2367)), 5 = stars ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)), 6 = crowns ([Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39)). The next time you attempt a check of the same type as your result, roll twice and take the better result, as the spirits of the harrow guide your actions. If not used by your next [daily preparations](/Rules.aspx?ID=2575), this benefit disappears.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
